intro: Bothriocline pauwelsii, commonly known as the Pauwels' thornbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a shrub that can grow up to 2 meters tall, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Bothriocline pauwelsii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
